item.title: Simulators: Space-time Point Patterns
item.description: Introduction Geographical processes such as crime, diseases, and pedestrian footfalls are extremely difficult to synthesise - they are inherently complex, and the theories for describing them are constantly evolving. Researchers often find themselves in a very precarious situation when carrying out real-life research projects, where data required to complete such projects are unavailable. Evidently, there are a number of legitimate reasons why such data might not be available, including confidentiality issues and the lack availability of usable data formats.
